did.abstract: Margaret and William Slater were long-time Fairfield County residents and collected journals, publications, clippings, and books related to African-Americans, African-American issues and history.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection is divided into two main parts - clippings and publications, both related to African-American culture and history.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Slater was a banker and one time manager of the Danbury office of the Connecticut National Bank. His wife, Margaret, was at one time Director of Easter Seals Rehabilitation in Stamford.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Ruth A. Haas Library Archives and Special Collections. E-mail: stevensb@wcsu.edu

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Collection was donated with 50+ books which have been added to the Haas Library circulating collection and the Archives' Rare Book Collection.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes materials on Benny Andrews, James Andrew Parker, Lena Powell, Susan Smith Mckinney-Steward, Judge Thomas Dickens, Earl Graves, Richard Clark, Peter Magubane, Ruth Washington, David Diskell, Andrew Young, Billy Taylor, Thomas Clark, Thomas Sowell, Vivienne Wilson Henderson, Hugh Smythe, and Adeline Woods Gomes.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes material on Black film stars before WWII, language issues, social issues, "Black English", music, Westport revival, Civil Rights revival, art exhibitions, reviews and editorials.
